resources.string: Hey, %s. Thanks for talking with me. You’ve been dealing with quite a bit, and it took a lot of strength to reach out to me today. \nFirst, I want to make sure you are doing alright.
I know it can be tough to reach out but please call this number for additional support.
Do you want police intervention right now or need medical attention?
Thanks for answering those questions so I could check in with you. I want to get a better sense of how you\'ve been feeling.
If they always complain that something more could be done

string.name: complaintResolution
string.i: Maybe something more could be done, but that doesn\’t reflect on you as a person.

resources.string: If they always say that they could have done better than you

string.name: betterResolution
string.i: Even if they could, which is often unlikely, there are always people who would have done better and worse than you and there is nothing wrong with that.

resources.string: If they berate you for not satisfying their needs

string.name: beratingAnswer
string.i: It’s not your responsibility to satisfy all of their needs.

resources.string: Do they consistently need to be in charge or control your actions?
If they monitor your phone calls, spending, chores, etc.

string.name: privacy
string.i: Keep in mind - it is your right to maintain some privacy.

resources.string: If they claim it is their right to make all the big decisions, treat you like a servant, or control your actions, whether because of their gender, race, or profession

string.name: equal
string.i: No one, including them, has the right to treat you as less than an equal.

resources.string: If they agree to go to an event, restaurant or store with you only to incessantly complain

string.name: punish
string.i: They may have been deliberately making it unpleasant to punish you for getting your way.

resources.string: If they act possessive and jealous

string.name: notLove
string.i: Acting possessive is not a sign of love, it is a sign that someone does not care about your well-being as much as theirs.

resources.string: If they make a hurtful remark and then accuse you of misinterpreting

string.name: deny
string.i: It’s just as likely that you did not misinterpret. Suggesting that you misinterpreted is often a way for someone to deny having said something hurtful.

resources.string: If they accuse you of over-reacting

string.name: bigDeal
string.i: It may not be a big deal for them, but it is for you, and you matter just as much.

resources.string: If they make others believe you are irrational or unstable

string.name: goodReason
string.i: You’re here thinking about abuse for a reason. Please trust yourself, even if right now it’s only because others ask you to.

resources.string: If they act confident and falsely compassionate

string.name: image
string.i: If they were truly compassionate towards you, you probably wouldn’t be here. Trust their actions more than the image they project.

resources.string: I appreciate you sharing your experiences. We realise there may be other types of abuse you’ve experienced that we haven’t covered.
Having your partner treat you like this sounds like a dark and lonely experience. Thank you for sharing that with us. Let’s talk about some alternative ways of thinking about your situation.
If they restrict or prevent your use of the car or other transportation

string.name: dangerous
string.i: This is dangerous and restrictive behavior, no matter how normal you are told it is.

resources.string: If they manufacture situations to prevent you from socializing such as:\n“You’re going to lunch with Sarah on Saturday? Oh tell her you can’t, I’ve been planning a weekend trip for us.”\n “You can’t visit with him because that makes me jealous.”

string.name: femaleIntuition
string.i: Your intuition is probably right if it tells you the situation is an excuse.

resources.string: If they tell you explicitly or implicitly that your friends or family do not care about you or if they provoke jealousies and rivalries

string.name: trueFamilyLove
string.i: Your friends and family cared about you before you met them, so they almost certainly care about you just as much or more now.
